has an sml:uri element containing a malformed URI.  Here is the source for that section:

   		<source sml:ref="true">
	        <sml:uri>
	           d:\access.log
	        </sml:uri>
        </source>
        
We should definitely not be throwing the exception that we're throwing, since the validator should just log a regular validation error for this condition instead of a runtime exception.  However, it also seems the source file needs to be corrected as well.

I fixed the exception.

The datacenter example now needs to be fixed so that the URI is well-formed.
Since the exception is fixed, I moved the actual task of fixing the datacenter sample to bug 189207.
